page.title: 01SEVEN SISTERS
page.content: {Seven Sisters}is a village in the Dulais valley.It appeared about 100 years ago when the local landowner sank a coal mine.It is bounded by Hirfynydd(south),y Drum(north)and March Hywel(west).The principal industry was coal-mining up until the mine closed in 1963.The village took its name from the pit and was never officially named except by custom and practice.Today most of the work-force have to commute to their places of work.The majority work either at the Rhigos trading estate ,Blaen-nant colliery or Lucas Industries at Ystradgynlais.The Forestry Commission have planted conifer plantations on the hills around the village and the N.C.B.have cleared the colliery site and the old coal refuse tips.Open cast and small mines are also found locally.
